Title:
The Data Behind the Dilemma: The Phylogenetic Status of
Acacia s. l. (Leguminosae: Mimosoideae)
Abstract:
Abstract The species of Acacia s. l. are currently
undergoing significant taxonomic upheaval. This is due, in a large part,
to the recent molecular work that has confirmed previous morphological
studies and concluded that the genus is not monophyletic. At least five
monophyletic lineages have been defined within the genus and, based
largely on molecular data, these are distributed throughout the tribes
Acacieae, Ingeae and Mimoseae of the Mimosoideae. We provide new and
review previous molecular data used to redefine the generic
classification of the genus into five segregate genera. This molecular
phylogenetic data provides evidence for well-supported monophyletic
lineages. The debate on the nomenclatural implications of which
phylogenetic level is recognized at the generic level is discussed.
